page.title: 02HUDSWELL VILLAGE
page.content: The village itself has developed over the years along both sides of the main street, and apart from the Pub, School, and Village Hall, the buildings are mostly cottages in differing styles of construction and architecture. The Post Office is a converted dwelling. There are only a small number of modern houses. Farms line the main street at both ends of the village. The Church of St. Michael and All Angels, is at the West End of the village where the road runs into the surrounding moorland. A small play area in the village contains some swings. The School is for children up to Secondary School age. Entertainment is home-made, a Folk Group meet at the Pub weekly. Sheep farming is the local industry.
